headline: Man Utd given fresh Matthijs de Ligt transfer update from Bayern Munich chief
body: Manchester United remain keen on signing Matthijs de Ligt from Bayern Munich this summer, despite paying £52million for Lille defender Leny Yoro less than a week ago
Bayern Munich's honorary president, Uli Hoeness, has suggested that Matthijs de Ligt will leave Bayern Munich this summer as Manchester United continue their transfer pursuit.

Despite stumping up £52million less than a week ago to sign wonderkid defender Leny Yoro from Lille, United still want to recruit Dutch centre-back De Ligt, who worked with Erik ten Hag at Ajax. Currently, though, the Red Devils are unwilling to pay the German giants' supposed £42m asking price after getting the green light from De Ligt and agreeing personal terms.
Negotiations are therefore at an impasse but Hoeness has echoed his fellow Bayern chiefs by admitting that the 24-year-old could depart for Old Trafford before deadline day.

"It's possible that a defender will leave," the Bayern chief told Sky Germany. "I would have no problem if [De Ligt] stays." Hoeness, however, then expressed his desire for De Ligt's team-mate, Dayot Upamecano, to stay. "Personally, I would not sell Upamecano."

Bayern sporting director Christoph Freund said similar to Hoeness at a recent press conference. "We've got a very good squad," Freund began in response to a question about players such as De Ligt leaving. "We can't rule anything out, including that players leave. There's no new update, although there’s a lot of speculation."

Ten Hag has since confirmed United's plans to sign De Ligt, claiming that the idea didn't come from him, having worked together at Ajax. "It remains to be seen whether De Ligt will come. I know Matthijs well and I will not deny that," the Red Devils boss admitted to Dutch outlet AD Sportwereld.
"I wanted to sign him two years ago but at that time he was already very far along to join Bayern Munich but believe it or not, his name did not come from me in the process [at United]."

Two centre-backs have already left United this summer, with the experienced Raphael Varane leaving as a free agent and youngster Willy Kambwala joining Villarreal in a £9.6m deal. The Red Devils are also trying to sell Victor Lindelof after the Sweden captain, 30, entered the final year of his contract without the option of a further 12 months like Harry Maguire.

headline: New theory emerges on why Jurgen Klopp quit Liverpool as ex-Reds star makes observation
body: Jurgen Klopp left Liverpool this summer after confirming he'd end his contract 12 months early, and one former Red believes one major factor in that decision has become apparent
Former Liverpool star Don Hutchison has shed light on what he believes could be a major factor in why Jurgen Klopp left Anfield.

Klopp departed Merseyside this summer after an illustrious nine-year stint that saw him hoover up silverware on Liverpool's behalf. That included ending a 30-year wait for the Premier League title, clinching the Champions League, winning both the FA Cup and League Cup (twice), as well as sealing the FIFA Club World Cup before leaving behind a squad equipped to sustain that success.

Despite having one year left on his contract, Klopp cited exhaustion as his reason to bow out ahead of schedule. The 57-year-old is lauded for bringing Liverpool back to the pinnacle of European football, but Hutchison - who played for Liverpool between 1991 and 1994 - reckons the Germans' achievements are even more remarkable given the financial firepower of their rivals.

The ESPN analyst delved into the spending spree conducted by the Premier League's aristocracy in years gone by. And that led to him developing a newfound respect for Klopp's decision to step down in the face of such relentless adversity.

"Don't underestimate the job that [Jurgen] Klopp done at Liverpool winning every single trophy," he wrote on X. "While Man [United] and Chelsea are spending a BILLION and Man City and Arsenal (I think [Mikel] Arteta £500million) spending outrageous amounts. No wonder Klopp thought I can't keep doing this. It's nearly impossible."

Hutchison offers a fresh perspective on precisely why Klopp decided to call it quits at Anfield after nearly a decade. The strategic genius was always open about his reasons for leaving since he first made the announcement in January, but this new theory suggests another dimension to what contributed to his fatigue.

"It is that I am, how can I say it, running out of energy," said Klopp at the beginning of 2024. "I have no problem now, obviously, I knew it already for longer that I will have to announce it at one point, but I am absolutely fine now. I know that I cannot do the job again and again and again and again."

While new boss Slot hasn't made any moves in the transfer market this summer, his competitors have been largely far from idle. Chelsea and United have been particularly proactive, shelling out close to £80m and £90m respectively, though the Blues have managed a net profit so far thanks to their selling.

However, Chelsea's net spend over the last five years tells a different tale, with the club's transfer deficit around £750m since 2020. United are next on that unenviable list having spent approximately £500m more on transfers than they've earned in the same timeframe, while Arsenal's own figure over that span isn't far off.

In comparison, Liverpool and Manchester City's net spend between 2020 and 2024 is closer to negative £250m, though tt only tells half the story for Pep Guardiola's side. That's because City's net transfer loss between 2016 and 2021 is around £650m, while the Reds overspent by only £100m during those first five years of Klopp's reign.

His tenure didn't come without its own hefty purchases, with the likes of Virgil van Dijk, Darwin Nunez and Alisson each costing big sums. But his time at Liverpool was also dotted with bargain buys like Mohamed Salah, Andy Robertson, Sadio Mane and Joel Matip, often maximising player potential once they became part of his setup.

Liverpool even managed to make a profit in multiple seasons while Klopp was attempting to rein the Citizens in at the top of the Premier League. The fact he managed to do so while beefing up the Reds' trophy cabinet is a testament not only to Klopp, however, but the work of those pulling the strings behind the scenes at Anfield.

headline: Liverpool target Takefusa Kubo gave clear response to 'huge Man Utd proposal'
body: Liverpool target Takefusa Kubo reportedly had a huge offer from Manchester United on the table, only to sign a new contract with current club Real Sociedad
Liverpool target Takefusa Kubo overlooked a jaw-dropping offer from Manchester United to sign a new contract with Real Sociedad.

The Red Devils were linked with the Japanese star midway through last season as they hunted a potential replacement for Antony, who has underwhelmed ever since arriving at Old Trafford and could soon be offloaded. United were ready to offer Kubo a whopping seven-fold salary increase as per the Express.

However, it was not enough to tempt the 23-year-old, who promptly signed a new contract with Sociedad, tying him to the La Liga club until 2029. However, more than six months later, the landscape has changed, with Liverpool said to be keen on signing the former Mallorca and Getafe loanee for around £55million, reports Japanese outlet Sponichi.

Kubo has previously spoken of his respect for Liverpool. He told GOAL in 2019: "The team I find interesting in terms of football right now is Liverpool. When I watch them, I feel like, ‘What an amazing team’. This is a little different from 'liking' them, it's more like, 'they're amazing'."

Kubo has developed impressively since then. Last season, he had 12 goal involvements in 41 appearances for Sociedad as they finished sixth and qualified for the Europa League. None other than Zinedine Zidane is a fan of the player, having hailed his performances during his loan spell at Mallorca while he was on the books at Real Madrid.

It has been suggested that Kubo has been earmarked as Mohamed Salah's long-term successor. The Egyptian has entered the final year of his contract, along with Virgil van Dijk and Trent Alexander-Arnold but  Mirror Football  understands Liverpool have ruled out selling him this summer even if he does not sign a new deal.

"On contractual situations, I don't think it would be fair for me to talk about these," Liverpool's sporting director Richard Hughes said recently. "These are private matters between club and players.
"The only concern I and Arne [Slot] have about situations is total commitment from the players to the cause for next season and we're absolutely convinced that will be the case."

headline: Mary Earps appears to aim pointed dig at Man Utd after summer transfer exit
body: England No 1 Mary Earps departed Manchester United upon the expiry of her contract and joined French giants Paris Saint-Germain on a free transfer
Mary Earps said she is eager to play for a "top team" in Paris Saint-Germain who are prepared to compete for silverware following her exit from Manchester United.

The England goalkeeper left the Red Devils earlier this summer upon the expiry of her contract after years of fierce speculation regarding her future. The 31-year-old joined the French giants on a free transfer, becoming the highest-paid goalkeeper in the women's game in the process.

Earps' move to the French capital comes after the shot-stopper demanded assurances from United's hierarchy of their ambitions for the women's team. United claimed their first major trophy since their 2018 relaunch with their FA Cup triumph over Tottenham Hotspur in May, but Marc Skinner's side also suffered their worst-ever top-flight finish during a volatile season.

United were thrust into an unsavoury light in recent months after reports emerged that their women's team were being moved out of their state-of-the-art training centre to accommodate the men's senior team, whose Carrington training facilities are underdoing a £50million revamp. New United minority owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe also admitted that plans for the women's team were "to be confirmed" as the "first team" took priority.

Speaking on her hopes for the next season, Earps, who is a European champion, World Cup finalist and two-time FIFA Best Women's Goalkeeper emphasised her anticipation to play for a side prepared to match her ambitions.
“I’m moving to Paris in a matter of days now," she told the  Daily Mail .

"There’s a lot to do in such a short space of time. But I am really looking forward to the new journey and this new chapter. I’m most excited to move to Paris for the football. I cannot wait to play for a top team and to be in a position to compete and win trophies over the next few years. That’s where I really want to be. Fighting at the top, I am really looking forward to that."

She added: “Generally, off the pitch I’ve heard incredible things about the city and I can’t wait to explore it. One thing about me is I love languages, so I am doing all I can to become fluent as quickly as possible.

"But it will be a challenge I reckon. I was out there the other week to sign for them and the city was crazy. The director of the club was pointing everything out to me like ‘this is the new stadium for the Olympics, and this one and this one’.”

Earps has signed a three-year contract with PSG, ending a five-year spell in the WSL with United having accrued 125 appearances along the way and establishing herself as one of the best in the business.
She is one of a number of high-profile exits from United this summer, including former captain Katie Zelem, forward Lucia Garcia and midfielder Irene Guerrero.
Earps previously admitted that a "club in transition" wasn't right for her as she remains at the peak of her powers when discussing her move to Paris.

headline: Jude Bellingham's four-word Man Utd transfer message that caused Erik ten Hag U-turn
body: Real Madrid and England phenomenon Jude Bellingham brutally snubbed Manchester United for the second time last summer, crushing Erik ten Hag's dreams of landing the Ballon d'Or hopeful
Jude Bellingham shut down talks of a Manchester United move before his Real Madrid transfer by saying “No, don’t be silly” - which sparked a U-turn by Red Devils manager Erik ten Hag.

It’s hard now to imagine Bellingham having joined any club but Real Madrid when he left Borussia Dortmund last summer. Dazzling in the ethereal white strip, we have grown accustomed to the 21-year-old, arms outstretched, embracing the Santiago Bernabeu faithful.

Bellingham’s 23 goals in all competitions propelled Real Madrid to a league and European double while cementing his own place as one of the sport’s preeminent stars. But rewind a year and his future was still very much undecided, with several of Europe’s elite clubs circling Dortmund’s Westfalenstadion in the hope they could get their clutches on England’s latest superstar.

One of the sides interested was Manchester United - Ten Hag was keen to bring in a new central midfielder in order to fill the Paul Pogba-shaped hole left the previous year. In a move not often seen by top-level managers, the Dutchman openly expressed his interest in the highly-rated Bellingham in April 2023.
He was asked by a fan outside of United’s training ground to bring in Kylian Mbappe and Bellingham, to which he smiled and replied: “Why not?” before driving away.

That was despite Bellingham openly rubbishing any links to United just a month earlier. A viral video on social media showed the Euro 2024 star being quizzed on whether he could become a Red Devil amid interest from Premier League rivals Liverpool and Los Blancos.
Asked “Are you gonna come Man U?” while posing for photos, the then-teenager chuckled and said: “No. Don’t be silly.”

As it became clearer in the following months that Bellingham’s preference was the Spanish capital, United cooled their interest, much to the frustration of Ten Hag. Of course, it wasn’t the first time England’s most successful club had been rejected by Bellingham already in his fledgling career.

He was earmarked for big things as early as his Birmingham City days, where at the time United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer formulated an elaborate plan to bring the youngster to Old Trafford. That included a face-to-face chat with legendary boss Sir Alex Ferguson and a tour of the training facilities by ex-football director John Murtough, though Bellingham snubbed their offer in favour of more immediate first-team opportunities at Dortmund.

It is clear now that he made the correct decision on both occasions. Four years later, Bellingham is hoping to edge other world beaters like Rodri and Vinicius Junior to the Ballon d’Or prize while United suffered their worst Premier League finish to date last season down in eighth place.

headline: Jurgen Klopp gave Man Utd plenty to think about as 'Jadon Sancho transfer talks begin'
body: Manchester United flop Jadon Sancho's footballing journey could have taken him on a completely different path if Jurgen Klopp had his way during his time at Liverpool
Jurgen Klopp revealed his interest in making Jadon Sancho a Liverpool player before his mammoth £72million move to Manchester United.

The former Reds boss admitted his appreciation of the England international in 2020 whilst he was still at Borussia Dortmund. In what was a highly productive four-year stint in Germany where Sancho scored 53 goals and contributed 68 assists for the Bundesliga giants, the Camberwell-born winger was attracting interest across Europe, specifically in the Premier League.

While links to United were consistent, there were rumours that ex-Manchester City youth Sancho would end up on Merseyside. These links were only fuelled stronger by Klopp's comments on the player, despite admitting he was doubtful the expensive purchase of the attacker would be possible.
"I don't think such a transfer will be possible this season," the German admitted in 2020 to German newspaper Bild. He also added: "The red shirt [of Liverpool] would suit [him] very well.
"He [Sancho] is a very interesting player. If he's coming to Liverpool I would be the most surprised of all of us."

It was only a year after Klopp's comments that Sancho made the anticipated transfer to United. And despite the lofty expectations placed on him thanks to his exploits in Germany, the Englishman never found consistent form in his first two seasons where he ultimately lost his place in the starting line-up.

His third season in Manchester ended before it even got started after engaging in a public fallout with Red Devils boss Erik ten Hag, who accused him of showing poor application in training. That then caused Sancho to hit back at his manager in a statement on social media.
His decision not to apologise to the Dutchman at the time saw him frozen out of all first-team activities and subsequently loaned out to Dortmund in January for the rest of the 2023/24 campaign.

A return to form in Germany saw Dortmund reach the Champions League final, albeit losing 2-0 to Real Madrid, but Sancho impressed nonetheless ahead of a return to his parent club this summer. The hatchet between manager and player has since been buried after Ten Hag confirmed Sancho's importance to United's success this past week.

headline: Man Utd transfer news: Bayern Munich respond to Matthijs de Ligt bid as secret clause revealed
body: Manchester United have already secured deals for Joshua Zirkzee and Leny Yoro and are determined to make Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt their third signing of the summer
Manchester United are certainly making their presence felt in the transfer market.
The Red Devils have secured two of the most expensive deals in the Premier League this summer. They first signed Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna - spending £36.5m in the process.

United then splashed out a further £52m to sign Lille starlet Leny Yoro and the spending doesn’t look like stopping there. Another midfielder and a further defensive addition are both on Erik ten Hag’s shopping list.
New players are linked with a move to Old Trafford every day. Find out the latest transfer rumours concerning Manchester United below:
Bayern Munich have turned down Man United’s opening bid for Dutch centre-back Matthijs de Ligt. The former Ajax star has been identified as a priority target by the Red Devils.
Reports earlier this summer suggested that De Ligt had already agreed personal terms with United. And they have now attempted to seal a deal with Bayern.

According to Bild, the Red Devils offered €30m (£25.3m) plus €5m (£4m) in add-ons but that was turned down by Bayern. Instead, the German giants want to receive around €50m (£42m) for De Ligt, meaning the ball is now in Man United’s court over a fresh bid.

Mason Greenwood has left Man United for Marseille - but the Red Devils could bring him back after a secret clause inserted into the deal was revealed. According to The Telegraph, a buyback clause was agreed upon between them and the French club.
It is clarified that such clauses are commonplace when clubs sell academy graduates and at this stage, Man United are unlikely to activate it.
Greenwood completed a permanent £26.6m move to Marseille last week, putting pen to paper on a five-year deal in the process. He spent last season on loan at Getafe.
PSG have reportedly revived their interest in captain Bruno Fernandes. According to L’Equipe, the French giants are interested in a deal for the Portuguese midfielder.

The French champions are actively scouring Europe for more firepower following the exit of Kylian Mbappe to Real Madrid - and see Fernandes as an option. Fernandes was previously linked with PSG before moving to Old Trafford. The 29-year-old has two years left to run on his contract with the Red Devils.

headline: Man Utd star was holding transfer talks in his kitchen when manager phoned home
body: Former England and Manchester United midfielder Paul Ince says Sir Alex Ferguson phoned him while he was holding transfer talks with another club in his house
Paul Ince says he received a call from Sir Alex Ferguson when he was seconds away from agreeing his Manchester United departure.

The former England midfielder spent six seasons at Old Trafford and played a central role in Ferguson's initial success at the club. But he ended up falling victim to the Scotsman's notoriously fractious nature in the summer of 1995.

Ince was just 28 at the time, and despite being a key figure in United's team his relationship with Ferguson had all but deteriorated. The club accepted a £7.5million bid from Inter Milan and that looked to be that, only for Fergie to make an ambitious last-ditch effort to keep him.

Speaking to Ladbrokes 1-2 Free, Ince said he couldn't believe it when his wife told him Ferguson was on the phone, not least because representatives from Inter - including club president Massimo Moratti - were standing in his kitchen at the time. "We were just about to sign the contract when the phone rang," he said.

"[My wife] picked it up and told me it was the gaffer. So I pick up the phone and ask him how he is. [Ferguson said] 'Listen, I'm in Colorado Springs on holiday, and I've been thinking, I don't want you to go now.
"I know we've got Nicky Butt coming through, but you're only 28, you're in your peak, I don't want you to go now'. [I replied] 'Sorry, gaffer, I've got Inter Milan in my kitchen'.

"The last thing I could do, in that moment, was turn around and say I was staying at United. They were the ones who had accepted the offer in the first place. They were the ones who wanted to use the money for the training ground. I'd set my heart on going to Inter."

Ince held firm and his switch to the San Siro was confirmed a few days later. He ended up spending just two years in Italy, but established himself, just as he'd done at United, as one of Inter's most pivotal players, particularly during Roy Hodgson's reign.

In 1997 he returned to England after signing for United's great rivals Liverpool. Red Devils fans didn't particularly appreciate his decision, and nor (we assume) did Fergie, but to Ince's surprise, the pair mended their damaged relationship soon after and now consider each other good friends.

"We've always spoken," Ince said. "I've been to [Ferguson's] house, played snooker... we get on really, really well. He's always great to be with; he's always shared his advice whenever I've been in management."

headline: Man Utd handed eight-word Adrien Rabiot transfer boost – thanks to star's mum
body: The French midfielder could be on his way to Manchester United two years on from almost sealing a transfer to Old Trafford after his mum made some telling comments
Manchester United have been given a boost in their pursuit of Adrien Rabiot with the French star's mum claiming the player's camp are "on excellent terms" with Erik ten Hag's side.

Rabiot's mum, Veronique, acts as his agent and in the aftermath of several failed moves to United, she revealed relations were still strong with the Red Devils despite Rabiot deciding against Old Trafford in the past. It now looks like a move for Rabiot could be back on with the player reportedly holding talks with United this week after finally calling time on his five-year stay with Juventus.

The Frenchman, 29, became a free agent at the start of the month after running down his contract. Rabiot looked to be on the brink of a move to United while he was still a Paris-Saint Germain player only for then-manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer to can the deal. A transfer then broke down in 2022, when allegations of huge wage demands saw Erik ten Hag opt for Casemiro instead.

However, there is no ill will from Rabiot's camp with Veronique saying: "We are on excellent terms with Manchester United." Talking to La Gazzetta dello Sport, she said that United expressed a desire to sign Rabiot in the past, although she claimed money was never discussed after the player had a change of heart.

"United wanted to meet me to illustrate their interest in Adrien, but we never talked about money in detail because he quickly decided to stay in Turin," she said in November 2023. "There were never any real negotiations."

The fact Rabiot's camp is still on positive terms with United will give fans hope he could finally line up at Old Trafford next season, however, there could yet be some jeopardy when it comes to securing their long-term midfield target with bitter rivals Liverpool also reportedly looking to speak with the ex-Juventus star. In a worrying turn of events for United, it also appears Rabiot is willing to speak to the Merseysiders as Arne Slot looks to make his first signing, as per Football Italia.

Other clubs expected to be in for the 29-year-old include Newcastle, while AC Milan and Napoli have been mooted as two clubs looking to try and keep the ex-PSG star in Italy. One potential factor in the player moving to the Premier League is reports that Rabiot is seeking a contract worth £7.5m a year - a figure that could see Serie A clubs discouraged from taking a punt on the French international.Juventus offered a base salary of £5.8m in their final contract offer but it seems the player is now looking elsewhere to continue his career. The French midfielder has won more than 20 trophies during his career including five Ligue 1 titles, the Serie A title and the Nations League while also helping his country reach the World Cup final in 2022.

If the transfer comes off, Rabiot could be Manchester United's third major signing for the summer after they landed Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna and Lille prodigy Leny Yoro after they persuaded the young star to join them ahead of Real Madrid.

headline: Everton devise plan to keep Jarrad Branthwaite as Man Utd continue to circle
body: Everton are ready to hand Jarrad Branthwaite a new deal at Goodison Park as they look to keep the defender happy amid continued offers from Manchester United this summer
Everton are preparing a new contract for Jarrad Branthwaite but still fear Manchester United could bid again for the defender.

The Toffees have told United they won’t entertain offers below their £70m valuation of the England centre-back. They have already rebuffed two bids from the Old Trafford club with the second worth up to £50m.

United have since gone out and splashed the cash on French teenager Leny Yoro while they are also trying to secure a deal for Dutchman Matthijs de Ligt from Bayern Munich. But the Toffees are not totally confident there won’t be another move for Branthwaite.
There is still concern at the club that the withdrawal of the Friedkin Group from buying out Farhad Moshiri could lead to financial trouble.

One of the stumbling blocks for the Friedkin Group was the £200m that Everton owe 777 Partners and ACap.  There are fears that Everton won’t be able to be sold until the Miami-based 777 group’s own legal trouble is sorted.

A claim of fraud has been brought by the London-based asset management group Leadenhall Capital Partners LLP. The Friedkin Group repaid a £158m loan owed to MSP Sports Capital and local businessmen Andy Bell and George Downing. It has no plans to call in that loan any time soon but the club remains in limbo.

Everton director of football Kevin Thelwell still wants to secure the long-term future of Branthwaite within their resources available as well as sorting out other incomings which are close, including the signing of Leeds winger Wilfried Gnonto.  Branthwaite, 22, is contracted at the club until 2027 which has given Everton a strong footing when it comes to United’s interest.

They want to extend that and also increase his salary to show their admiration to the player for not asking to leave so far. But if United do return with a third bid then there could be issues on both fronts.

Everton have just sanctioned the sale of Amadou Onana for £50m, which will ease any financial fears had by the Merseyside outfit. The midfielder joined Everton from Lille for £33m in 2022 and his departure represents a healthy profit for the club - who did find themselves on the wrong end of PSR last term.

headline: How long phone call with Rio Ferdinand took to persuade Leny Yoro to join Manchester United
body: Leny Yoro looked fated to join Spanish giants Real Madrid from Lille this summer, but with the help of Rio Ferdinand, Manchester United were able to snag a significant summer signing
Leny Yoro needed just 10 minutes on the phone with Rio Ferdinand to know his future lay at Manchester United.
Yoro signed a five-year contract with the Red Devils after they successfully hijacked Real Madrid’s move for the 18-year-old Lille defender, in a huge sign of intent from United's new hierarchy.

The Frenchman appeared determined to join the Spanish giants, who are in the market for a defender. But Real were only willing to fork out between £21m and £25m for his signature, as Yoro was in his final year of his contract - a fee that the French club were not happy with.

Comparatively, United committed to paying an initial fee of £52million, with a further £6.7m in add-ons. Even so, the Red Devils still needed to convince Yoro that making the move to Manchester was the best step for his career.

And while new chief executive Omar Berrada played a crucial role in getting the deal across the line, working with his new colleagues, sporting director Dan Ashworth and technical director Jason Wilcox, as well as director of player negotiations Matt Hargreaves, it was former centre-back Ferdinand who had the ultimate influence.

On the role Ferdinand played in leading him to Old Trafford, Yoro said: "This is Rio Ferdinand, this is a legend in Man United, so for me this is an honour. This is a big defender, a legend, so yeah, big honour for me.

"It was like two weeks ago. He called me, so first of all I was really impressed to speak with him and yeah , we spoke like 10 minutes about Man United, so he helped me a lot to make my choice. So yeah, it was really an honour to speak with him.

"Yeah, he spoke to me about the club, and [that] this is a historic club with a big story, and if I go there I need to fight for the club, to be ready, because this is the biggest club in the world. So, yeah, for me it was really good to speak about this."
He added: "When I was younger, Rio was one of the best defenders in the world. I think everyone watched United when he was young and, for me, it was a dream to play for this club."

It's not unchartered territory for Ferdinand. The United legend helped his former club land defender Raphael Varane back in the summer of 2021. Fittingly, it is Yoro who has essentially replaced Varane in the United squad, after the 31-year-old left upon the expiry of his contract.

headline: Dan Ashworth's 20-word comment on Erik ten Hag speaks volumes on Man Utd U-turn
body: Manchester United chiefs elected to stick with Erik ten Hag for the upcoming season, and hand him a new contract, despite holding talks with other managers after last season's eighth-place Premier League finish
Manchester United sporting director Dan Ashworth insists the club must again measure itself by sporting success.
And in Erik ten Hag, he believes they have one of the best coaches in Europe with which to achieve that goal.

The Dutchman’s future had been in question since Sir Jim Ratcliffe purchase a minority stake in the club and took sporting control of affairs at Old Trafford. Ratcliffe earlier this year set out his determination to knock City and Liverpool “off their perch”, but was unconvinced that Ten Hag was the right man for the job.

However, after United’s FA Cup success - defeating City in the final at Wembley - and holding talks with a number of other managers, the decision was made to stick with Ten Hag and give him a chance under the club’s new look leadership - even handing him a contract extension.

Now Ashworth, who officially took up his new role at the start of this month, has made his feelings on that situation clear insisting that the decision to stick with Ten Hag showed: “Our strong belief in him as one of Europe’s top coaches, and the partner we want to continue working with.”
He added: “It’s my job, together with (technical director) Jason (Wilcox), to create the right support structures and environment around Erik, the staff and players to make that possible.

“Already, I can feel a strong sense of energy and determination around the group, as the players and staff return fresh from their breaks, including some exciting new additions to the squad, and to the coaching team.”

In a message to supporters published on the United website on Monday, Ashworth also made clear that while United have continued to reap commercial benefits in recent years, they need to get back to winning ways on the field, in terms of league titles and competing at the elite level in the Champions League.

“This remains one of the biggest football clubs in the world, but that is not our measure of success.The focus is on getting back to being among the best on the pitch. It won’t happen overnight, but, together with (new chief executive) Omar (Berrada) and his new leadership team, we will not rest until we have achieved it.

“We are all clear that last season fell below the required standards in the Premier League and Champions League but, by winning the FA Cup in such impressive fashion, our players and staff showed what they are capable of when everyone pulls together and performs to their potential.
“Our collective challenge is to reach those levels much more consistently.”

headline: Bruno Fernandes and Antony's chequered past as Man Utd change transfer plans
body: Antony's two-year stay at Manchester United could be coming to an end having been a source of frustration for both fans and some of his team-mates due to his performances
Manchester United winger Antony could be heading for a temporary exit as the club is reportedly open to loaning him out.

The 24-year-old, who joined from Ajax for a hefty £86million fee two years ago, has been a divisive figure among fans and even his team-mates, including captain Bruno Fernandes. Their on-pitch spats were particularly evident during the 2022/23 season.

Fernandes could be seen demanding more from Antony in multiple games, with the pair repeatedly exchanging verbals. Despite these tensions, manager Erik ten Hag downplayed any serious conflict between the pair.

He said at the time: "They are both players who play with the heart and, when they bring that in the game, they are on their best so it's always a kind of balance. And always between players, sometimes emotions flare up.
"But I think, in the second moment, they are already good with each other so that is not a problem. I think definitely the players are not frustrated with him."

However, Antony's lacklustre performances in his second season did little to win over critics, with instances like his kick at Jeremy Doku in the Manchester Derby highlighting his apparent discontent. Arsenal icon Ian Wright reckoned Fernandes was sending the wrong message as his skipper, though, by playing on his own.

"For Bruno sometimes, he just goes off and they're not ready. It's not good for the team," Wright blasted. "Watching Antony come on and his contribution was to kick out at Doku like that, but the example of the captain is seeping in. That's the captain doing it."

Despite the previous tension, Fernandes praised Antony after their 4-3 FA Cup victory over Liverpool in March. "In the last 15 minutes, no one's probably going to talk about it, but Antony made a great effort playing as a left-back to help us," he told MUTV.
However, if a club agrees to cover his £70k-a-week salary, the Brazilian might find himself playing elsewhere next season. United need to offload players if they're to continue recruiting.

Antony could be one of those sacrificed, despite Ten Hag always backing him. Just this week he told AD: "I am still convinced that Antony has the potential to play at this club. He certainly showed that potential in the first month: he scored three times in his first three games. After that, it became more difficult, last season was not good."

headline: Sir Alex Ferguson smashes world record to buy unbeaten Paul Nicholls horse
body: The ex-Manchester United manager, who paid £633,000 with his partners for Caldwell Potter in February, will be among the new owners of the unbeaten Regent’s Stroll, now the most expensive jumps' horse
Sir Alex Ferguson, who broke transfer records during his legendary managerial career, has shattered his own record to add another recruit to his squad of racehorses.
In February he became one of the new owners of Grade 1-winning jumper Caldwell Potter, who fetched £630,000 at Tattersalls in Ireland, which was then the highest amount paid for a jumper at auction.

And on Monday Ferguson raised the bar even higher when he was revealed as one of the new owners of the exciting Regent’s Stroll, unbeaten in two bumpers for trainer Paul Nicholls, who has cost a cool £660,000.

Regent’s Stroll was among eight horses who will return to Nicholls’s Ditcheat stables after the 14-time champion jumps trainer splashed well in excess of £1million at the horse sales to keep hold of some of his best talent.

He had faced losing some of his brightest stars, including Cheltenham Festival winner Stay Away Fay, after long-time owner Chris Giles announced he was taking a break from racing. It was revealed at the time that “with a young family and increased work commitments both here and abroad, he has less time to devote to racing and his horses”.
Giles’s pink and purple silks have been synonymous with Nicholls former stars Zarkandar, two-time King George VI Chase winner Silviniaco Conti and Greaneteen as well as Stay Away Fay.

Stay Away Fay, who has won four races including the 2023 Albert Bartlett Novices’ Hurdle at Cheltenham, was the headline lot of the Goffs Summer Sale in Doncaster where 11 Giles horses were to go under the hammer.
Stay Away Fay fetched £325,000 and Scottish Champion Hurdle winner Rubaud £200,000 who, like Regent’s Stroll, were knocked down to bloodstock agent Tom Malone on Nicholls’s behalf.

“We got all the ones we wanted back, so we’re delighted,” said Nicholls. “I’ve had some fantastic support from all my owners to get them back. I put people together to buy them and some of the co-owners bought them back. It’s worked out really well.

“Stay Away Fay is going to be owned by Andy Bell and Fergus Lyons. In Regents Stroll there is a combination of John Hales, Ged Mason, Sir Alex Ferguson and Neil and Alfie Smith who are ;part of a team we have put together. They bought Caldwell Potter in the spring and they are both nice horses.”

Nicholls, who also trains the ex-Gordon Elliott Caldwell Potter, continued: “I bought Regent’s Stroll as a store two years ago at Doncaster. He won his two bumpers at Ascot and Newbury. We didn’t want to be losing him, did we?
“It would have been disappointing to have lost them but we’ve have worked hard to get the right support from owners across the board and been able to keep them together.”

headline: Dan Ashworth makes promise to Man Utd fans in open letter explaining Erik ten Hag call
body: Dan Ashworth has talked about the decision to keep Erik ten Hag at Manchester United and outlined his plans as sporting director in an open letter to Red Devils supporters
Manchester United sporting director Dan Ashworth has declared his ambition is to ensure the club returns to being among world's best, and not simply to be a big club.

Ashworth arrived at Old Trafford after the Red Devils agreed a deal with Newcastle earlier this summer, after a period on gardening leave as the clubs struggled to come to terms. The former Brighton director now oversees his first summer in a senior role at United, working with chief executive Omar Berrada and technical director Jason Wilcox who are also newly-appointed by co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

The 53-year-old chief's arrival has coincided with deals being agreed for forward Joshua Zirkzee and teenage central defender Leny Yoro. This summer has the potential for a significant overhaul on and off the pitch as United look to bounce back from their worst ever Premier League finish.

It was the decision to continue with Erik ten Hag that was Ashworth's first duty however. The sporting director believes that the Dutch manager is one of the best in Europe and that FA Cup success hints at what the team is capable of.
“Omar Berrada has started as chief executive, and Jason Wilcox as technical director, and I can assure you that we have lost no time in getting to work," said Ashworth in a open letter.

"Our first big decision of the summer was to extend Erik ten Hag’s contract as men’s first-team manager to June 2026, reflecting our strong belief in him as one of Europe’s top coaches, and the partner we want to continue working with to get the team back to the levels expected.

"We are all clear that last season fell below the required standards in the Premier League and Champions League but, by winning the FA Cup in such impressive fashion, our players and staff showed what they are capable of when everyone pulls together and performs to their potential.

“Our collective challenge is to reach those levels much more consistently. It’s my job, together with Jason, to create the right support structures and environment around Erik, the staff and players to make that possible. Already, I can feel a strong sense of energy and determination around the group, as the players and staff return fresh from their breaks, including some exciting new additions to the squad, and to the coaching team."
Ashworth went on to outline changes taking place at the club. He suggested that the academy and women's sides will see a great deal of attention too.

"There are also changes to the physical environment at Carrington as work commences on our season-long £50 million redevelopment of the training ground – evidence of our commitment to improving the club’s infrastructure," he continued.

"This will require some adaptation this season, but all our teams – men’s, women’s and Academy – will maintain access to high-quality facilities, with the promise of a fully refreshed, world-class site once the project is completed.

“Delivering a successful women’s team and a thriving, productive Academy are both key objectives of my job, and I have a strong background in both areas. Women’s football was an important part of my remit in past roles with Newcastle United, Brighton & Hove Albion and the FA, and it will be the same at Manchester United. Women’s football is arguably the most exciting area of growth in the global game, and we want to be part of that.

“Last season’s FA Cup win was a fantastic landmark as our first major women’s trophy, and now we want to build on that with Marc, his staff and the players. Youth development has also been a huge part of my career and I see it as a crucial element of success for any football club – but especially for Manchester United where homegrown players have such a rich history.

“The success of our Under-18s during the 2023/24 campaign bodes well for the next generation of men’s talent coming through, and the same is true on the women’s side, with both our Under-21s and Under-16s finishing the season with trophies. Overall, my first impression is the scale of opportunity available to us at Manchester United as we review and refresh all areas of the club.

“This remains one of the biggest football clubs in the world, but that is not our measure of success; the focus is on getting back to being among the best on the pitch. It won’t happen overnight, but, together with Omar and his new leadership team, we will not rest until we have achieved it.”

headline: Bruno Fernandes' Man Utd transfer ultimatum as PSG plot move for Red Devils skipper
body: Bruno Fernandes has emerged as a top target for Paris Saint-Germain this summer, with Manchester United now bracing themselves to receive a bid for their captain
Bruno Fernandes issued Manchester United and ultimatum over his future in May as PSG eye a move for the midfielder.

Fernandes has starred for the Red Devils ever since his arrival in January 2021 and was named captain by Erik ten Hag at the start of last season. But it turned out to be a miserable campaign for Ten Hag's side.

New controlling co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe has ordered an overhaul throughout the club, with Fernandes not one of the players who was marked out as being off-limits for interested suitors this summer.

PSG appear increasingly likely to test out United's stance on keeping hold of their skipper. And just two months ago, Fernandes set out what the Red Devils need to do to ensure he remains at Old Trafford.

"The club needs to want me," Fernandes said in May. "I feel the club wants me to be a part of the future. As I said always, I don't want to be a player that the club doesn't want to have. If for some reason they don't want to have me, I will go. But if they want me, I will stay.‌

"I am no different from anyone just because I have the armband. I always try my best and we always do the best we can for the club - nobody hides that we play for a big club and we have to lift our standards every game."

Fernandes' comments will be ringing in United's ears as they brace themselves to receive a bid from PSG. According to L'Equipe, the French giants 'really appreciate' Fernandes' talents as they seek to replace Kylian Mbappe.

The midfielder has previously been linked with a move to Saudi Arabia, though expected interest from Al-Nassr has not come to pass. Now, PSG boss Luis Enrique has given his backing to a sensational move.
Talks are expected to intensify between the two clubs over the future of the Portuguese international. United boss Ten Hag has been adamant that he wants his captain to remain at Old Trafford.
"No, absolutely, the club wants to keep Bruno," Ten Hag said immediately after Fernandes' interview, which came following United's final home game of last season.

‌"I have to see the interview, maybe it's your interpretation, but from everything I know from him he loves Manchester United, the fans of United and to play for United. He always gives his best and is an example, even with injuries.

"He loves football and wants to win. That is how I would describe his character. I'm very pleased with his performances. It's not easy when so many players are injured around him and he has to carry the team."

headline: Erik ten Hag makes two swift transfer calls after Man Utd's start to pre-season
body: Manchester United have enjoyed a busy transfer window so far with a number of incomings and outgoings and two youngsters are set for loan moves following the Red Devils' pre-season tour of America
Manchester United are set to ship two young prospects out on loan, despite the pair impressing in pre-season.

Striker Joe Hugill scored in United's 2-0 win over Rangers, while goalkeeper Radek Vitek was named player of the match as they suffered a 1-0 defeat to Rosenborg. A number of young players have received increased opportunities early in pre-season, with 11 United stars enjoying extended breaks after featuring at Euro 2024 or the Copa America.

According to a report from the Manchester Evening News, both Hugill and Vitek are set to feature on United's upcoming pre-season tour of the United States before completing loan moves away from Old Trafford.

Hugill and Ethan Wheatley have featured up front for the Red Devils so far, although Rasmus Hojlund is set to report for duty in time for the trip to America. However, both Joshua Zirkzee and Alejandro Garnacho are expected to miss the tour, offering Hugill more chances to impress.

The 20-year-old spent time at League One side Burton Albion last season and registered four goal contributions in 18 games "It was a great loan, getting to a men's first-team changing room," Hugill said of his experiences at Burton after scoring against Rangers.
"Having to fight for three points constantly in the league [was great] and playing Saturday then Tuesday was tough, but that's what you're there for at a young age."

Vitek, meanwhile, joined Accrington Stanley on loan last January after signing a new deal and made 18 appearances for them in League Two. And with Altay Bayindir and Tom Heaton enjoying extra leave after Euro 2024, Vitek will likely deputise for Andre Onana in America.

However, the report states that both Hugill and Vitek will have loan moves 'confirmed after the tour ends', with United returning to the UK on August 4. Vitek in particular is said to be attracting 'significant' interest.

"It is really good that the young lads are getting the opportunity as when you step on the field you have to show yourself," Vitek told club media after his start against Rosenborg. "It is a big opportunity in front of a lot of people that are watching you.

"You have to demand the best from yourself. It is an amazing feeling as the fans have been amazing. Lots of them at our hotel, even in the stadium the crowd was amazing: a full stadium of Red shirts."

headline: WSL 24/25 fixtures: Chelsea discover first opponents of Sonia Bompastor era
body: The Women's Super League fixtures have been released ahead of the division's kick-off in late September and Chelsea will hope for early success under new boss Sonia Bompastor
Women's Super League champions Chelsea will kick off their campaign under new boss Sonia Bompastor against Aston Villa.

The Blues will get their season underway at home without Emma Hayes in the dugout after the legendary manager brought her stint in west London to an end to take on the role of head coach of the United States. Hayes guided the side to a fifth title in a row as they prevailed over Manchester City on goal difference after beating Manchester United 6-0 on the final day of 2023/24.

Last season's runners-up face a difficult task on the opening day as they travel to third-placed Arsenal. It sees Vivienne Miedema makes a rapid return to north London after the Dutch forward signed a three-year deal with the Citizens following the expiry of her Gunners contract.
Newly-promoted Crystal Palace will make the journey across London to face Tottenham in their first ever WSL match. Laura Kaminski led the side to promotion from the Championship.

The opening two weekends of action sees a number of matches already selected for television. Chelsea vs Aston Villa will be shown on BBC but has yet to have its date and time confirmed while the blockbuster clash between Arsenal and City will be on Sky Sports kicking off at 12.30pm on Sunday September 22.
Chelsea will be televised for first away trip of the season too, against Crystal Palace. They will kick off at 7.30pm in south London and be shown on Sky Sports.
Meanwhile Manchester City vs Brighton has been selected for viewing on BBC on Sep 29, with a 12.30pm kick-off.

Last season's top two sides do not face-off until November. Chelsea will welcome city when the men's game is paused for an international break on November 16/17. The return leg will be played in March 22/23 with six games remaining in the division.

headline: Man Utd transfer target failed medical TWICE as dream move collapsed
body: Manchester United had scouted Accrington Stanley goalkeeper Toby Savin extensively and wanted to sign him but the 23-year-old failed two medicals in two different transfer windows
Toby Savin ended up joining Shrewsbury Town after twice missing out on a dream move to Manchester United.

Savin was playing for Accrington Stanley when the opportunity to move to United first presented itself in January. The 23-year-old goalkeeper had been lined up to become a back-up to Andre Onana and Altay Bayindir, with Tom Heaton nearing retirement and Nathan Bishop leaving for Sunderland.

But Savin, who had been scouted by Newcastle and Tottenham as well, ended up failing a medical to scupper his chances of a move in the middle of the 2023/24 season. Another chance presented itself in the summer after he was released by Accrington, but The Sun reports he once again couldn’t get past the medical checks.

Savin has struggled with a shoulder injury of late and featured just nine times in League Two last season. The injury robbed him of a move to United, but Shrewsbury were not put off, signing him on a two-year deal this summer.

“Toby attracted interest from clubs higher up the leagues,” Shrewsbury manager Paul Hurst said. “He is a player with plenty of potential and has all the attributes to be a really good goalkeeper. Our job is to make sure he fulfils that and becomes the best version of himself.”

Savin has not been able to join his new team-mates in pre-season yet, with the injury still keeping him off the pitch. He missed Shrewsbury’s first two friendlies against Birmingham and Brackley Town.

“Toby, nothing is amiss there, everything is how we expected,” Hurst said. “Toby is gradually getting fitter. We will see how he goes next week. He won’t be involved on Tuesday night, but as I said that was our understanding anyway.”

body: The Saudi Pro League continues to be a popular destination and big-spending clubs are targeting a host of Premier League players this summer including Man City, Man Utd, Arsenal and Liverpool stars
Saudi sides continue to splash the cash after tempting Cristiano Ronaldo and Neymar to the Middle East.
Clubs in the Gulf State have spent huge sums to draw some of Europe’s standout stars to the Saudi Pro League. Millions and millions have been committed to growing the league.

And that shows no signs of slowing down this summer. Aston Villa star Moussa Diaby has become the latest to put pen to paper on an eye-watering contract just a year after arriving in the Premier League.
He could be followed by a host of colleagues. A number of stars from Manchester United, Arsenal and Liverpool have all been linked with their own big-money switches. Take a look at the latest here:
The Brazilian’s move to Arsenal hasn’t quite worked out as intended due to a combination of injury and inconsistency. That could see the Gunners cash in on him.
Jesus has been identified by Al-Ahli as a top target for the summer. Should he agree to a move, he would be reunited with former City team-mate Riyad Mahrez in Jeddah.
The striker has three years left on his contract at the Emirates Stadium but could fall down the pecking order this summer should Arsenal move for a new striker as expected.
Jesus is not the only Brazilian striker that Al-Ahli are interested in. They are also plotting a move for Tottenham star Richarlison.
The former Everton and Watford star has struggled for form since his big-money move to North London. He has scored just 15 goals over the past two seasons.

Richarlison has also been linked with Al-Hilal this summer but was forced to release a statement disputing that a move was imminent. Taking to Instagram, he said: “I left my vacation and came to work to come back better ahead of next season. Regarding what's been said in the media in the last few days, it's fake news. I will NOT leave England ahead of next season.”

The latest to be linked with a move, De Bruyne’s future is certainly up in the air. The Belgian playmaker has just a year remaining on his contract and previously admitted he would be open to a Saudi move.
And it appears that it has moved a step closer over recent days. Reports in Italy suggest that De Bruyne has agreed personal terms with Al-Ittihad.

They now need to enter talks with Manchester City to agree a deal for his services. De Bruyne would join Karim Benzema, Houssem Aouar, Fabinho and N’Golo Kante should he complete a move to Al-Ittihad.
De Bruyne is not the only Man City star who could be tempted to Saudi Arabia. Al-Ittihad have also targeted his teammate Ederson.
The Brazilian is reportedly keen on a move but a deal seems some way off. A £25m offer was lodged to Man City but was instantly rebuffed by the Premier League champions.
While Ederson is staying put for the time being, it appears that Pep Guardiola is planning for his exit. City have been linked with a move for PSG ’s Gianluigi Donnarumma as a possible replacement.

From one Brazilian goalkeeper to another, Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson Becker has regularly been linked with a big-money move to Saudi Arabia. Reports suggested that he was set to hold talks with Al-Nassr.
They already boast former Liverpool forward Sadio Mane, who will likely be thrilled to be reunited with his former team-mate. Alisson, 31, has three years remaining on his contract.
Any exit would leave new Reds boss Arne Slot with a huge decision to make between the sticks. Liverpool currently have Caoimhin Kelleher in reserve but he too has been linked with a move away.
One of the most high-profile names linked with Saudi, reports suggesting Salah could move on refuse to go away. Liverpool have already been forced to intervene in the past to keep him.

Al-Ittihad lodged a huge £150m bid for the Egyptian last summer and the Reds insisted that he was to stay. Salah has now entered the final year of his Anfield contract and his future remains up in the air.
Saudi sides remain interested, while Salah has returned to Liverpool for pre-season training. There could well be further updates over the coming weeks.

headline: Man Utd star Alejandro Garnacho issues clear response to Lionel Messi accusations
body: After helping Argentina win the Copa America earlier this month, Manchester United starlet Alejandro Garnacho has faced some stiff allegations about his relationship with Lionel Messi
Alejandro Garnacho has hit back at accusations he ignored Lionel Messi during the Copa America final.

Argentina clinched their third major trophy in four years after beating Colombia in the showpiece at the Hard Rock Stadium in Florida, USA earlier this month. It initially looked as if the night would end in misery for Messi, who was hauled off with an ankle injury on 66 minutes.

Seconds later, the Inter Miami superstar, 37, burst into tears on the bench, stricken by the pain both gushing through ankle and of bowing out of what's likely to be his last ever international final. But sadness turned to elation when Lautaro Martinez netted the winner with eight minutes left of extra time to seal Argentina's second successive Copa America title.

After the game, videos emerged on social media appearing to show Garnacho, who spent all but 26 minutes of the tournament warming La Albiceleste's bench, continually snubbing Messi throughout the evening. The Manchester United star was closest to the eight-time Ballon d'Or winner when the tears started flowing, but failed to offer his team-mate any comfort.

Several other clips showed the 20-year-old walking past Messi during the post-match celebrations, seemingly refusing to embrace the legendary forward. Accusations then began flying that Garnacho, who has declared an admiration for Messi's eternal rival Cristiano Ronaldo more than once, was purposefully avoiding the ex-Barcelona man, but the player himself has now rubbished those claims.

On Saturday, he responded to a post on X containing a video compilation of him 'ignoring' Messi during and after the final by uploading a photo of his own - one with his arm around Messi after the full-time whistle. He then captioned the post using the 'shrug' and 'facepalm' emojis.

Garnacho is one of a select group of players to have played with both Messi and Ronaldo, having lined up alongside the latter during the Al-Nassr ace's brief return to Old Trafford. He's made no secret of his love for Ronaldo, having copied the Portugal international's goal celebration on a couple of occasions, but any suggestion this has caused a rift between him and Messi is evidently baseless.
The youngster, who has six Argentina caps under his belt, broke into United's first team halfway through the 2022/23 season. He's since racked up 86 appearances for the Red Devils, scoring 15 goals.

With the likes of Messi, Martinez, Julian Alvarez and Angel Di Maria ahead of him in the pecking order, breaking into Argentina's first team is proving a little harder, but plenty feel it's only a matter of time until he does, including Di Maria.

"[Garnacho] is a very fast player, he has incredible ability," the ex-Real Madrid man said earlier this year. "He is going to gain it with experience and coming to the national team, it is a place where you learn a lot and continue to improve. It helped me a lot to grow technically in every way, it is spectacular.

headline: Man Utd secretly inserted Mason Greenwood buyback clause into Marseille transfer dealVIDEO
body: Mason Greenwood has joined Marseille on a five-year contract after Manchester United decided he couldn't continue with the club, but they have left the door open for a possible return
Mason Greenwood’s Manchester United career might not be over after the club inserted a buyback clause into the deal which sent him to Marseille.

Greenwood joined Marseille on a five-year contract on Thursday after the French side agreed to pay United £26.6million for his services. The 22-year-old striker has left his boyhood club permanently after spending last season on loan with Getafe.

He left for Spain last summer after United conducted an internal investigation, which concluded Greenwood would play no further role for the club. Greenwood was charged with attempted rape, engaging in controlling and coercive behaviour, and assault occasioning actual bodily harm in October 2022.

Those charges were dropped in February 2023 by the Crown Prosecution Service, who said “a combination of the withdrawal of key witnesses and new material meant there was no longer a realistic prospect of conviction”, but led to his departure from United by mutual agreement. United included a sizable sell-on clause in the transfer agreement with Marseille, but they have also left the door open for a potential return in the future.

The Telegraph reports that such a clause being inserted is commonplace when selling academy graduates and it is very unlikely United will exercise it in the future. Yet they were not compelled to do so and its existence suggests United might go back on their original decision to expel Greenwood.

In a statement last August, United said: United said: "All those involved, including Mason, recognise the difficulties with him recommencing his career at Manchester United. It has therefore been mutually agreed that it would be most appropriate for him to do so away from Old Trafford, and we will now work with Mason to achieve that outcome.

"Based on the evidence available to us, we have concluded that the material posted online did not provide a full picture and that Mason did not commit the offences in respect of which he was originally charged. That said, as Mason publicly acknowledges today, he has made mistakes which he is taking responsibility for."

At his first press conference as a Marseille player Greenwood stressed that he won’t speak about the past following a backlash from some fans and the city’s mayor. "I understand the questions, I don't want to talk about it too much or get into debates and controversies,” he said.

“I already spoke about it on Thursday with the supporters and I spoke about it last season. I want to move forward, I want to be part of Olympique de Marseille. My intention is really to concentrate on the football part. The staff and players told me about the foundation, associations and hospital visits and like the other players I will participate in these initiatives.

"This season I will try to play well for Marseille, at the Velodrome in front of fantastic fans. I have been waiting for this for a while and I can't wait to play in front of this crowd. For the moment I am focused on what I have to do with my club."

headline: Liverpool star sends Erik ten Hag clear warning over Alejandro Garnacho
body: Alejandro Garnacho became a key player for Erik ten Hag last season, but the Manchester United boss has been urged to manage the winger carefully by rival player Alexis Mac Allister
Liverpool star Alexis Mac Allister has warned Erik ten Hag not to put too much pressure on Alejandro Garnacho.

Both Mac Allister and Garnacho were part of the squad that helped Argentina to win the Copa America this summer. But while the Liverpool man started all but one game, Garnacho only featured in the final group match.

The Manchester United star entered the tournament off the back of a breakthrough season for his club. He scored 10 goals and notched five assists in all competitions for the Red Devils, making 50 appearances in total.

The Argentine is set to play a key role again this campaign, with the right-wing spot now his to lose in Ten Hag's line-up. But international team-mate Mac Allister believes United need to be careful.

The Liverpool midfielder has hailed both Garnacho and fellow Argentine youngster Valentin Carboni. Though he also insisted both club and country need to guard against placing too much expectation on them.

"He hasn't played much, but in training he has shown what he's worth, I think he has earned the respect of the team," Mac Allister told YouTube channel 'AFA Estudio' the week after Argentina's Copa win.

"He and Garnacho are two players who can give a lot to Argentina. They excite us a lot. We have a lot of hope for their future. We can't burden them with too many expectations at the moment, but in the future they will give us a lot."

Garnacho caught the eye for United last season, memorably scoring an overhead kick away at Everton. In the reverse fixture he won both of his side's penalties in a 2-0 win, drawing praise from boss Ten Hag.

“He is progressing very well. We’re very pleased with this. His contribution today was huge with his runs and dribbles. He’s effective for the audience as well. We want to show something - dribbles - well-deserved penalties," the Dutchman said.
"He is a player that needs a challenge and likes one. Our job is to push him to high levels. He has high potential and we have to get the potential out and therefore you have to work day by day.
"It is only about him, if he can keep the focus and if he puts the right effort in, he keeps the focus, sometimes for young players it is difficult. We have their job to do."
It was not all smooth sailing though, with Garnacho forced to apologise to Ten Hag for 'liking' tweets criticising his management following a trip to Bournemouth, in which the winger was substituted.

headline: Erik ten Hag's Jadon Sancho comments immediately put to the test by PSG
body: Jadon Sancho had been expected to quickly depart Manchester United this summer but has already been involved in pre-season under Erik ten Hag and now appears to be garnering interest
It was just a matter of days ago that Erik ten Hag suggested that Manchester United need players at Jadon Sancho's level, and now his words will be put to the test.

A public falling out last season saw Sancho banished from United's squad before moving on loan to Borussia Dortmund in January. A swift exit was expected this summer but showdown talks between the parties have seen Sancho return to training with the Red Devils.
The 24-year-old winger even started United's friendly win over Rangers at Murrayfield. It appeared to reflect Ten Hag's assertion that peace talks had gone well.
“We spoke well. Anyone can make a mistake. If the player reflects well on that, then you draw a line and move on again," Ten Hag said in an interview.
“This club needs good players, and one thing is for sure: Jadon is a terribly good player. I hope that the click still comes, and that he will contribute to our success.’’

Reports in France suggest that Paris Saint-Germain are willing to test the resolve of club and player. The Ligue 1 champions are aiming to strengthen their ranks following the departure of Kylian Mbappe.

Earlier this summer it was suggested that Sancho had a £40million price-tag, well short of the £73m they paid in 2021. They may quickly need to decide whether that fee is worth more to them than the ex-Man City academy star's services.

PSG are said to be nearing an agreement for personal terms with Sancho. Sporting director Luis Campos was impressed with the England international's outings for Dortmund as the German side reached the Champions League final.

Sancho's future will unlikely be decided by Ten Hag alone however. New United sporting director Dan Ashworth will play a role and United's Dutch boss has made clear that he has never taken transfer decisions alone at the club.
"I have never made decisions about new players on my own, far from it," said Ten Hag. "I never negotiate.

"So when people argue that I spent so much money at United: no, the club has done. They keep me broadly informed about the numbers. I only know what the player will earn, because I deal with the hierarchy in the locker room. As for transfer and agent fees, I’m not involved in any of that.”

Erik ten Hag desperately wanted Frenkie de Jong in his first summer at Manchester United but the player's wage deferral with Barcelona proved to be a stumbling block in talks.
United were eventually forced to abandon their pursuit of De Jong and alarm bells rang after defeats against Brighton and Brentford in the first two Premier League games.

It seemed like nothing had changed after a trainwreck 2021/22 campaign, so United reacted by splashing £70million on Casemiro, who signed from Real Madrid on a four-year contract, but the length of the deal was questioned and another Bastian Schweinsteiger situation was feared.
Thankfully, it didn't take long for Casemiro to silence the doubters and he was brilliant in his first season, helping United win the Carabao Cup and qualify for the Champions League.

That's why his rapid decline last season was so surprising. He went from being a yard ahead of play to being behind it, his passing became sloppy in some matches and reckless and mistimed tackles crept into his game, which was another sign of his qualities diminishing.
Casemiro was brilliant in his first year in Manchester and poor in his second. He is now 32 and it was always possible he would succumb to decline at Old Trafford.

The decision to sign Casemiro for £70m was a high-risk, high-reward move. United gambled he could sustain his performance levels and he demonstrated his quality in Ten Hag's first season in charge, but they made a bet he wouldn't decline so quickly into his time at the club.

Whether the gamble on Casemiro has paid off is up for debate. Without him, United wouldn't have enjoyed the success they achieved in 2022/23, although he's one of the highest earners in the squad and his performances last season far from merited that financial status.

It would be foolish to completely write Casemiro off given his magnificent career and what he's achieved. He could prove fears he's over the hill wrong this season and bounce back to his previous levels, but the early signs haven't been great and United are looking at new midfielders in his position, which is an admission from the club that his performances were below the standard required.
Unfortunately, it seems more likely that Casemiro's best days are behind him and he will be reluctantly added to the club's catalogue of mistakes if that proves to be true.

Former football director John Murtough, who was hired by the Glazers and gradually promoted, was responsible for laying the groundwork to sign Casemiro in 2022 and signing an ageing player for an inflated fee and giving him huge wages was a Glazer speciality over the years.
The Glazers always spent money, but how they spent it was the problem and their scattergun recruitment strategy is the reason for United's regression in the Premier League.

Casemiro might be remembered as the American family's last bad decision in the transfer market. Some may argue that Antony is a bigger mistake since he was signed a few weeks after Casemiro, however, he's younger and retains slightly more value, despite struggling himself.
Spending £70m on a player and receiving just one excellent season in return isn't good business and United will be gambling again if they don't sign a quality No.6 this summer.
Sir Jim Ratcliffe's new football structure understands the importance of signing a defensive midfielder and United are interested in Martin Zubimendi and Manuel Ugarte.

United might have to get creative in the transfer market and attempt to negotiate a deal similar to their agreement for Sofyan Amrabat, who was signed on loan with a clause included for a potential permanent transfer, so they can afford a deal for a new midfielder.
That is a consequence of poor planning and signing Casemiro for £70m two years ago. You shouldn't have to replace a player so soon when spending such a fee.

United will renew their rivalry with their neighbours in the Community Shield on August 10 after beating them in May's FA Cup final. Sometimes described as a glorified friendly, it will mark their final outing ahead of the Premier League opener against Fulham six days later.

The Reds will step up their preparations for the forthcoming campaign this week, flying to the United States for their pre-season tour. They will face Arsenal this weekend before taking on Real Betis and Liverpool.

United are yet to confirm their travelling squad for the tour, but it is highly likely Leny Yoro will be the only new signing Erik ten Hag will take with him. Fellow new recruit Joshua Zirkzee is entitled to three weeks off after representing the Netherlands at Euro 2024.

United, of course, could add to their squad while in the US, just as they did last year when they swooped for Andre Onana. He was a late addition to the squad after signing two days before their opening game of the tour.

Having signed a striker and a centre-back so far this summer, United's attention has now switched to bolstering their midfield. They want to bring in a new defensive operator that can sit at the base of the engine room, following Casemiro's sharp decline last season.

United have expressed interest in Real Sociedad's Martin Zubimendi and are continuing to be heavily linked with Manuel Ugarte of Paris Saint-Germain. Elsewhere, AS Monaco's Youssouf Fofana has once again been mentioned as an option.

With United still in need of fresh legs, both in midfield and elsewhere, MEN Sport has had a look at what United's ideal 20-man matchday squad could look like once the competitive action gets underway next month, provided they make further progress in the transfer market.

Starting with the starting XI, Onana will continue as the club's first-choice goalkeeper. Ahead of him, Diogo Dalot is primed to remain at right-back and be joined in the back-four by Lisandro Martinez, Luke Shaw and Yoro.

United consider Yoro to be a signing for the present and the future, meaning Ten Hag will be keen for him to develop an on-field partnership with Martinez. That combination currently represents United's strongest centre-back pairing on paper.
Moving into midfield, Kobbie Mainoo and Bruno Fernandes are guaranteed starters, leaving just one position up for grabs. That, of course, is the defensive midfield berth.

Ugarte is attracting plenty of attention and the prospect of him arriving at Old Trafford on loan has not been dismissed. United need to raise funds through player sales before committing to more big-money deals.

As for the attack, competition for places in the wide areas is high. Alejandro Garnacho and Marcus Rashford occupied the two wide spots for the FA Cup final and it would not be a surprise to see them start 2024/25 in the same roles.

Amad, however, will have ambitions of making the right-wing berth his own after ending last season strongly and impressing against Rangers at Murrayfield Stadium on Saturday. Garnacho is yet to report back for pre-season training after representing Argentina at the Copa America, meaning Amad has a golden opportunity to audition for a starting berth on the tour.

In the centre of attack, Rasmus Hojlund is expected to remain Ten Hag's first-choice striker. He notched 16 goals in his debut season at Old Trafford and will have aspirations of building on that tally, meaning Zirkzee may have to settle for a place on the bench.

As for the bench, Ten Hag will be allowed to name nine substitutes, meaning he will have plenty of scope to cram as much talent into each of his matchday squads as possible. Altay Bayindir should claim one of those places, providing cover for Onana as second-choice goalkeeper.

United will be forced into recruiting a new right-back if Aaron Wan-Bissaka is sold and AS Monaco's Vanderson has reportedly been identified as a successor. The Reds remain keen on signing another centre-back and Matthijs de Ligt is still an active target with a £42m bid claimed to be enough to seal his signature.

If Casemiro is sold, United, in addition to signing Ugarte, would still require another defensive midfield signing to give them two options for that role. The prospect of bringing Sofyan Amrabat has not yet been dismissed and he would be a good squad player.

Mason Mount and Scott McTominay, should the latter be retained, would both be hoping to be regular fixtures in the matchday squad at the very least. Antony, Amad and Zirkzee would provide the attacking threat from the bench.
